A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
This was hands down and pants off the worst production that has ever had the Star Wars brand attached to it. 

On the upside the actors worked their damnedest to salvage the script handed to them and it shows. The special FX is also in line with what you would expect of a modern day multi-million dollar production. 

But that is where the praise ends. There are bewildering inconsistencies between this entry and The Force Awakens\, a disastrous filler arc\, near-zero character development\, and plot holes so glaringly large that even the Death Star couldn't possibly erase them in a single lazer blast.

All in all this film insults your intelligence as a viewer with it's antics. I firmly believe the writers\, as well as director Rian Johnson should consider a new line of work.
